message.content:
To start, we extract the key figures from the provided statements.

1. From the balance sheet at End_date:
 • Total current assets = 20,314,894.50  
 • Inventory = 9,100,000.00  
 • Total current liabilities = 1,015,922.54  
 • Total assets = 30,858,088.75  
 • (There are no additional liabilities given, so we use Total Current Liabilities as total debt.)  
 • Total Owner's Equity = 29,842,166.21

2. From the cash flow statement:
 • Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –18,924,462.44

3. Calculations:

A. Current Ratio  
 Formula: Current Assets ÷ Current Liabilities  
 Calculation: 20,314,894.50 ÷ 1,015,922.54 ≈ 20.00

B. Quick Ratio  
 Formula: (Current Assets – Inventory) ÷ Current Liabilities  
 Calculation: (20,314,894.50 – 9,100,000.00) ÷ 1,015,922.54  
       = 11,214,894.50 ÷ 1,015,922.54 ≈ 11.04

C. Debt to Asset Ratio  
 Formula: Total Debt ÷ Total Assets  
 Calculation: 1,015,922.54 ÷ 30,858,088.75 ≈ 0.03

D. Debt to Equity Ratio  
 Formula: Total Debt ÷ Total Owner’s Equity  
 Calculation: 1,015,922.54 ÷ 29,842,166.21 ≈ 0.03

E. Cash Flow to Debt Ratio  
 Formula: Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities ÷ Total Debt  
 Calculation: –18,924,462.44 ÷ 1,015,922.54 ≈ –18.63

Now we present the results in the required JSON format.

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Ratio": "20.00",
    "Quick Ratio": "11.04",
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.03",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.03",
    "Cash Flow to Debt Ratio": "-18.63"
  }
}
